Module : gpstimet¶

This module contains various functions to accomodate the easy handling of date and/or datetime obects.

Documentation¶

gpstime.mjd2pydt(mjd, fmjd=0.0)[source]¶

Convert a date given in Modified Julian Date format, to a Python datetime object. The input MJD can be split in any convinient way between the parameters mjd and fmjd. Or fmjd can be ignored and the date passed in mjd.

Parameters:
  • mjd – The Modified Julian Date; can be either float or integer
  • fmjd – In case the MJD is plit in two parts, this is the second part of the input MJD. E.g. if MJD = 57222.75, then, for increased accuracy, one can use mjd = 57222 and fmjd = .75.
Returns:

A Python datetime object, representing the input (MJD) date.
gpstime.pydt2gps(datetm)[source]¶

Transform a Python datetime instance to gps week and seconds of week.

gpstime.pydt2ydoy(datetm)[source]¶

Transform a Python datetime instance to year and day of year.

Returns:A tuple consisting of

[year, day_of_year, hour, minute, second].

gpstime.ydoy2gps(year, doy, hour=0, minute=0, seconds=0.0)[source]¶

Transform a tuple of year and day of year (i.e. doy) to gps week and seconds of week.

Returns:A tuple consisting of [gps_week, sec_of_week].
gpstime.ydoy2mjd(year, doy, hour=0, minute=0, seconds=0.0)[source]¶

Transform a tuple of year and day of year (i.e. doy) to Modified Julian Date and fraction of day. Optional arguments include hour, minute and second.

Returns:A tuple consisting of [mjd, fmjd], where mjd is the (integer) Modified Julian Date and fmjd is the fraction of day (float).
gpstime.ydoy2pydt(year, doy, hour=0, minute=0, seconds=0)[source]¶

Transform a date, given as year and day of year (i.e. doy) to a valid Python datetime instance. Optional arguments include hour, minute and second, all integers.

Returns:A datetime instance.

Examples¶
